reviewText: "The Dream Giver" was one of my favorite of Bruce Wilkinson's books, and I found it quite profound, though because of the charming style it is written in, I have known of people who have read it superficially and completely missed the point of it; These teaching "Sessions" give an in-depth exposition of the principles laid out in the book, and will inspire and guide you to be all that God intended you to be, if you are willing to get out of your "Comfort Zone", conquer your "wall of fear", and mostly, to listen to His will, and do His bidding.Most of us have had a dream for our lives since childhood, and for many they remain unfulfilled. It takes a lot of courage to step out of one's "Comfort Zone", journey to "Borderland" and face those who tell you "it can't be done", only to wander in "The Wasteland", and battle the "Giants of Defeat". It's a process those who have succeeded in following their destiny have gone through, and fewer still have passed the ultimate test, which is to give their dream to God, letting Him be "The North-star of your life".Dr. Wilkinson gives examples of people who have spent years in the Wasteland, where God sharpens the skills you will need for the attainment of the Dream. King David is one, and Joseph another. Joseph learned to manage Potiphar's household, and then the jail he was thrown into, before he was ready to manage the land of Egypt, and these are examples to remember when we feel defeated by the dryness of our circumstances, should we be wandering in that Wasteland, and most of us have spent time there.Though Dr. Wilkinson rambles a bit when recounting his time in Africa, there is a lot of food for thought in these stories, on the journey to "become the person you were called to become".This set of 8 "Sessions", at approximately 286 minutes, are filled with honesty, humor, and invaluable life lessons. Dr. Wilkinson's teaching is always Bible based (though in this series unlike the "The Prayer of Jabez", "Secrets of the Vine", and "A Life God Rewards" teaching tapes, he does not quote directly from the Bible), and contains timeless truths, and tells us that ultimately "a dream is filling a need that God places before you" for others, and teaches us to be "a good steward of that dream".

reviewText: I feel like God brought this dvd in my life so I could share it with others who needed a nudge to get on the path to do what He had given them a passion to do. It is a powerful tool, and I've seen people step out in faith and completely change the course they were on and trust God for the future.  It has been so exciting to see God at work!!

reviewText: In almost didn't pick it up for viewing---there is so much self-help and God stuff on the market---yet I felt a persistent tug, and so here I am...this DVD is worth it!  I found much of the first side of Wilkinson's DVD presentation redundant (that's where it loses the 5th star).  However, I made myself sit through it (remembering that not everyone is starting on the same page as I am) and was richly rewarded.  I now understand many of the struggles I've had in moving forward with my dreams.  For the first time I can truly value and be grateful on a deeper level for my Wasteland experiences (or "Dark Nights of the Soul"). This presentation helped recognize a recent invitation to Sanctuary/Respite/Restoration, which, God willing, I will accept.  The final examples of how honesty in the Valley of the Giants were tremendously moving, inspiring and restore my faith in humanity and peace on earth...which we can all work together towards achieving, one person at a time, beginning with ourselves.  Let's go for it!!!
summary: Patience through the repetition will be rewarding

reviewText: There are people who change your life by helping you map out your goals. They truly encourage you to achieve a true measure of success. Then there are individuals who change the world by changing your heart and by giving you goals you never even thought were possible until they opened the door to new ideas.Bruce Wilkinson is a beautiful soul who was sent to earth to change the world by changing hearts, one person at a time. His message goes way beyond daily goals and yearly goals as he maps out ideas to change the world. This DVD takes you from the birth of a dream to a roadmap of how it actually becomes a reality.As you view this DVD you will become instantly intrigued by the similarity of the path to dream fulfillment. Bruce Wilkinson brings a completely new understanding to living your life in a way that makes it possible for you to achieve goals you have always known were possible.On your path you will face giants, despair, fear, new challenges and situations where your heart and head will battle for control. His thoughts about "sanctuary" bring in a spiritual element that is nurturing and healing and the story he tells is truly beautiful and inspiring.This is truly fascinating to hear someone explain this process especially if you are on a journey to a dream being realized. During the last two sessions I was overwhelmed by the profound message of hope for the world and I know if you watch this DVD you will realize that your big dreams may not only be dreams for your future, but they may even be gifts to the world. After watching "The Dream Giver" you may find yourself with a deeper understanding of how your life can influence the world for good.~The Rebecca Review
